content.description: Sit start at the left corner and pull up onto a juggy rail. Traverse right, avoiding the lip. Top out at the corner.
content.location: Back side of the Squid Boulder

content.description:
A short, fun, and unique climb that's worth the walk if you're looking for something different.  

  Sit-start in the corner where the wave meets the vertical face. Pull onto the wave with a funky first move, then stem up the two faces to the top out.
content.location: On the back side of the Squid Boulder.

content.description:
Seemingly covered in moss and trees when viewed from the trail, the backside of this boulder features a wave that seems foreign amongst the slabs and aretes of the area.  

  The Tide and Stem the Tide are two fun and easy problems that are good for warming up or anyone looking for something different. There looks to be a ~V4 crimp problem on the face that the wave meets up with, and additional cleaning might uncover some cool sit-start problems on the overhanging area to the right.
